649.sentence: there is an alarm , i still havent used it yet , but it should be good .

650.sentence: there is a clock , and date , which can get helpful .

651.sentence: the player has firmware , which will remove the glitches , if there are any .

652.sentence: the music plays awesome , never skips , even if u run for a bit , so you can listen to music without interruption .

653.sentence: the one and most major thing that i was dissapointed with , in this player , is the battery life .

654.sentence: the panel seems like it will come off very easily as other people have said .

655.sentence: you need the software to actually transfer files

656.sentence: the player has its minor glitches like for example when i turn it on , 60 percent of the time , it sais , shutting down , which means i have to turn off , and turn it on again , which is not to my likings .

657.sentence: also , the player sometimes freezes , not a very big problem , but can also be annoying .

658.sentence: and also , it 's priced very affordably .

659.sentence: with 40gb of storage i have about 7,500 songs on the player ( everything music file i have is on there ) with room for about 2,500 more .

660.sentence: the software interface supplied was very easy to use but i went ahead and got red chair 's " notmad " software because of some advanced features i wanted .

661.sentence: the sound is great even with the supplied earbuds -- but i find earbuds uncomfortable so i use different headphones .

662.sentence: sound settings can be adjusted for personal preference .

663.sentence: accessing files by artist and album ( i mostly look things up by artist ) is easy and intuitive .

664.sentence: possibly the biggest advantage this player has ( if price was n't enough ) is the fact that the user can replace the battery him / herself by opening the lid and popping in the new battery .

665.sentence: since batteries do run out on everything , this will also be a big money-saver since ipods , irivers , rca , dell , all have built-in batteries that need to be replaced by a technician ( apple charges 100 bones for the battery replacement ) .

666.sentence: try before you buy if at all possible : although i am a mac addict now for over a decade and everyone i know has previously bought an ipod , the nomad zen xtra was a far better value and is just as easy to use with regards to both hardware and software interface .

667.sentence: i like the nomad 's color better , but it 's not terribly flashy .

668.sentence: i have had mine for a month now and have to say i have enjoyed it .

670.sentence: sound quality is wonderful , i really like the smart volume sound normalization .

671.sentence: yes the included earphones suck but everyone replaces them anyway .

672.sentence: i quickly got to use to the interface and can find any song / playlist etc fast enough .

673.sentence: i also liked the fact that you can save custom playlist you made on the player not just the computer !

675.sentence: the front cover can pop off easily but i always have mine in the case so i did n't notice after first day .

676.sentence: have had the player since xmass and love it !

677.sentence: great sound , very long battery life ( i routinely play it for 12 + hours ) , very fast recharges rate , removable battery , storage size , nice screen , firmware updates , and great price .

678.sentence: short warranty ( 3 months , so i got the extended warranty at best buy ) , occasional freeze up ( easily fixed by popping out battery ) , somewhat flimsy navigation wheel .

679.sentence: this is an excellent player , especially for the price , with features that are comparable to and even excel the ipod .

680.sentence: for a price that 's still less than even the lowest level ipod i was able to get this 40gb monster , and the best part is it works as great as it was advertised to and then some .

681.sentence: the system is terrific in size and design , imo looking better than the ipods .

682.sentence: it 's very solidly built , and has a nice dense feel to it .

683.sentence: i find all of the controls well-placed and not flimsy in the least .

684.sentence: the scroll wheel is better than the ipod 's as well , in that you do n't risk giving yourself a cramp running your thumb around in circles endlessly - just a small nudge of the finger and you 're there .

685.sentence: the screen 's large and easily read .

686.sentence: the only beef i can raise in this regard is the pop-off face , that sometimes comes off a bit easily , but besides that it 's perfect .

687.sentence: sound : exceptional , though i can 't really compare it to the ipod .

689.sentence: yet after ensuring that all the id3 tags are in order ( with the software which is actually not as bad as people make it out ) it actually turns out to be really handy .

690.sentence: playlists can be generated on the fly ( which is a bit clunky but still a really nice bonus ) or by using the software , and there are a bevy of eq options .

691.sentence: the only thing missing is an option to adjust the balance .

692.sentence: as i mentioned before , the creative mediasource software is actually really robust despite what others have said , though notmad may still work better .

693.sentence: it 's easy to transfer , preview , and organize files .

694.sentence: the in-program id3 tag editing is a strong point , as well .

695.sentence: it was no problem for me to use their software .

696.sentence: overall , i 'm giving this 5 stars as i 've seen nothing of the problems people have repeatedly cried havoc over , but as i 've only had the player for a while i leave room for doubt if the headphone jack , hissing , or scroll wheel problems show up with me too .

697.sentence: please consider this much superior piece of equipment before plopping down half a grand for an ipod .

699.sentence: unfortunately , after loading 280 + songs , all i get now is " player either not connected or busy . "

702.sentence: i took perfect care of this player and still it died in the week after the lousy 90 day warranty ended .

703.sentence: the software is not good either and the driver has trouble working with other sound blaster products , which is very dumb .

705.sentence: once again , the sound is awesome , the batterly life is only 6-8 hours , and that is because all my music is 320 kbps which does affect the battery life .

706.sentence: however , my hard drive did fail , and i have not dropped it once .

707.sentence: because other people that complain about this player are talking bull , this player is awesome , it just breaks fast , which is horrible .

709.sentence: every time nomad thinks the file is corrupt the os freezes .

710.sentence: the sound quality is very good .

711.sentence: the controls are somewhat harder to use , and there are some oddities about the software tagging system , but most people can live with this .

712.sentence: having access to so much music where ever you go is terrific .

713.sentence: typically , the problem is the headphone jack -- it was for me and many others .

714.sentence: i 'm convinced by my own experience and that of many other people who have posted here who have had the same experience that the product is defectively designed , and will not hold up to normal use .

715.sentence: the headphone jack seems to be a major problem .

716.sentence: the one other thing i observed while i had the nomad is that the front cover , which is taken off to have access to the battery , seemed to come undone very easily .

717.sentence: the headphone jack failure seems to occur just about when the warrranty period is to expire .

718.sentence: the other day when i was listening to a song , it locked up and will not do anything now .

719.sentence: in that model the hard drive just died one morning before my class .
